function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Close social interactions in the living rooms and open spaces increase the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of use of individual refrigeration equipment despite its availability increases the risk of discomfort and potential health issues in high temperatures.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased hot water usage in households leading to higher risk of waterborne diseases transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased usage of household appliances involving water consumption leading to potential waterborne diseases transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher energy usage in households leading to potential indoor air pollution and respiratory health risks.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inherent biases in the recruitment of participants for the study, leading to potential underrepresentation of vulnerable areas and populations.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Digital gaps and limitations in the use of internet forms leading to potential exclusion of certain demographics and populations.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential bias in participant qualification due to a higher representation of teleworking individuals.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential over-representation of categories in the data sample","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential exposure to contagious diseases during qualitative research settings","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of exploration of the impact of daily tasks on households during covid-19 lockdown","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Changes in energy consumption patterns due to altered habits","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Omission of household income from the questionnaire","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Negative spatial perception and mental health effects due to poor housing quality","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of spatial flexibility and independent supplies in dwellings","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor indoor environmental quality and associated health risks","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of stable access to resources for telework and daily living","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficient thermal installations and power appliances leading to increased indoor energy consumption","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate storage and space for domestic tasks leading to overcrowding and lack of essential space","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited access to open-air spaces and nature contact leading to reduced well-being of occupants","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of questionnaires, photographs, and testimonies increases the risk of personal data exposure and privacy breaches.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Accessing homes for research purposes poses a risk of spreading contagious diseases, especially if proper precautions are not taken.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Substantial funding challenges for protected and conserved areas pcas","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Funding gaps in the global south for pcas","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High costs of expanding the area of land and sea under protection","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on narrow financing base, including international development assistance and tourism revenues","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Structural factors limiting the effectiveness of conservation spending","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Covid-19-related impacts on pca finance","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reduction in tourism revenue for pcas due to travel restrictions and decline in global tourism","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Shift in tourist demand from international to domestic markets due to pandemic, leading to potential revenue losses for pcas.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reduction in domestic public budgets, leading to potential reallocation of funds away from pcas.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reduction in official development aid and philanthropy for pcas due to economic recession and fiscal constraints in donor countries.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Decreased charitable giving","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rollbacks to regulations or cuts to pca agency budgets may affect the rights of indigenous peoples and local communities iplc .","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Advanced rollbacks under the cover of a public health crisis may exacerbate the risk of future pandemics by further damaging ecosystems.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Economic recovery stimulus efforts of the largest economies have favored investing in business-as-usual practices rather than in carbon-neutral and nature-positive actions, leading to a negative ’green stimulus index’ score for 16 of the 20 g20 countries.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Over-dependence on a single funding source for pcas","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate public support and interest in nature conservation and pcas","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient revenue generation from tourism for pcas","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dependence on cyclical funding sources, such as seasonal tourism, may lead to financial instability and funding gaps.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Heavy reliance on private sector investments may lead to prioritization of profit over public health and safety leading to reduced financial sustainability for disease prevention and control efforts.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Crowdfunding campaigns may lead to increased public gatherings and physical interactions, contributing to the spread of contagious diseases like covid-19.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The spread of contagious diseases such
